0.11.text: So I have this friend who is gay. He sits down and tells me this

4.80.text:
as if expecting some sort of reaction
like I'd be delighted or ashamed

8.49.text:
and all I can do is hug him and tell
them it's okay

11.70.text: Ok..Of course it's ok. Man, of all the words to say. Yet Ok on this day is the only phrase

17.70.text: How brave, he is braver than most in the world today. Than you or I or anything that thinks

21.89.text: That to be gay is just 'ok'

23.32.text:
Yet I can see where he might
be scared 'cause there's always one one

28.15.text: who says that it's Adam and Eve, not Adam and Steve. Man, those people infuriate me

32.14.text:
when we live in a world where sometimes
it's illegal for a man to hold hands with a man

36.26.text: Love is banned. Politicians debating what's natural and what's not

39.71.text: while those third world kids, what have they got?

42.10.text: Not enough to survive an impoverished life, and that's natural?

45.40.text:
With open armed churches
preaching 'love thy neighbour'

48.27.text:
but not like that, take a step back. That's
the world he's looking at

51.94.text: and what about me, 'straight' guy here, though I've been called 'camp', 'fag', 'girly', 'queer'

56.70.text: I've been called them all cause my hair's quite fancy and I sing high notes

59.70.text: Which makes me a stereotype and a pawn to insults but I'm not insulted

63.53.text: And when people ask if I'm straight or gay, I change my answer every day

68.00.text: But now gay marriage is becoming legal, some have opened their eyes finally accepting

72.07.text: that gay rights are human rights

74.00.text: And now my friend can be himself, no threat of mental bruises

77.30.text: My friend is free to love whoever the hell he chooses

80.10.text: It's not gay marriage, it's just marriage, no horse drawn carriage

83.20.text: Just two people in eternal bliss

85.50.text: And if you tell me it's not what God wants

87.70.text: Then your God doesn't know what love is
